meanings.definition: The upper layer of soil, typically rich in organic matter and nutrients.
meanings.sent1: Farmers plant crops in the topsoils to ensure they have enough nutrients to grow.
meanings.sent2: Gardening enthusiasts often take care of the topsoils in their yards to promote healthy plant growth.
meanings.sent3: The topsoils in the garden were so happy to be home to the new flowers.
meanings.sent4: The topsoils of knowledge in his mind were fertile ground for new ideas to grow.
meanings.sent5: The topsoils whispered secrets of growth and life to the roots of the plants.

meanings.definition: To cover with or as if with topsoil.
meanings.sent1: The farmer topsoils the field before planting the seeds for the next season.
meanings.sent2: After the construction was complete, the workers topsoiled the area to restore the natural landscape.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to topsoil the sandbox to make it more like a real garden.
meanings.sent4: She topsoils her flower beds with care, ensuring the plants have a good environment to grow.
meanings.sent5: The landscaper topsoiled the lawn, transforming it into a lush green paradise.
